subject: Re: [junit] Instantiated TestCase won't run tests
msgSnippet: ... What often happens is no-one approves moderated posts for three days and a bunch of people get angry. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
Mike Clark wrote:
>
> On Dec 21, 2004, at 7:38 AM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> While I appreciate the energy you put into answering questions here, I
> often wonder what might happen if you didn't have the energy. Perhaps
> by letting questions linger a bit longer, the collective energy of the
> community would kick in so that you didn't feel like you had to answer
> every question.

What often happens is no-one approves moderated posts for three days and
a bunch of people get angry.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
